conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C and D.
Predict which container (E, F or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
Each baffle directs the falling stream toward the next deflector below it, creating a zig-zag path.
Tracking those directions shows that A ultimately reaches the leftmost pocket (E).
Liquid from A flows into container E.
B ends one pocket to the right (F).
Liquid from B flows into container F.
C is guided across to the turquoise pocket (G).
Liquid from C flows into container G.
D, starting far right, follows a similar rightward path and also empties into G.
Liquid from D flows into container G.
